intro: Struthanthus sincorensis, commonly known as the Sierra foothill flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Struthanthus sincorensis is an annual herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
